title: Camshaft - Inspection

body.body: Inspect the camshaft sprockets for damage and worn or broken teeth.

Position the camshaft to the cylinder head in its correct location. Ensure that the camshaft sprocket is positioned as for removal.
Wipe the exposed areas of one of the camshaft journals and the corresponding position on the camshaft frame.
Apply a thin smear of grease to the camshaft journal and a small quantity of silicone release agent to the corresponding position on the camshaft frame.
Size a piece of Plastigauge to fit across the camshaft journal.
Fit the Plastigauge to the camshaft journal using the grease to hold it in place.
Fit the rocker shafts to the camshaft frames, at this stage, it is not necessary to fit the cam followers.
Tighten the camshaft ladder bolts by hand until the under head areas are in contact with the camshaft frame.
